document_data.mainbody:
anycoins Hall was the primary manycoins services establishment operated by the city of Khôltar, south Faerûn, circa the Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR.
This edifice was located at the western end of Hael Way, although it faced Dubrinlar (the gate through the west wall of Khôltar) across the wide intersection of the two triple-wide streets, Hael Way and Orntathtar Way, as did its next door neighbor, the Malgart House. Across Hael Way, to the south, was the popular luthdren (restaurant) Vandanamers. Diagonally to the southwest was the Maerador House of Welcome. Diagonally to the northwest was Darrusktraal, the garthraun (police) station and duty-house for Dubrinlar.
Manycoins Hall was a large, almost cubic building that was styled to radiate dignity. Whether it succeeded or not was a matter of taste.
The lobby contained a map of the city that was large and detailed enough to show each building in the city. The buildings were not named but were labeled with codes that only had meaning to the tax collectors.
The main purpose of Manycoins Hall was as a bank and currency exchange house, but they also drew up and witnessed trade agreements and contracts for a small fee. Scribes were available for hire to make copies of documents.
